article_title: Expanded insurance, pay-for-performance boost health care
article_text:
Expanded insurance, pay-for-performance boost health care Youth uninsured rate down, and study shows doctors improve when paid for outcomes

Photo: Mayra Beltran, Houston Chronicle El Dr. Jorge Suárez, de Bolivia, examina el 9 de febrero de 2015 a...

There may be a new group of Obamacare defenders growing every day, and they are in the middle- and upper-incomes.

og.description: New studies published in the journal Health Matters show the benefits of Obamacare. The uninsured rate among young people between 19 and 25 years of age has dropped 11 percent with the implementation of the Affordable Care Act. Middle- and upper-income parents have insured their children the option under Obamacare to keep young adults on their parents' policies the most. Another study found that when 40 percent of a doctor's pay was tied to their patient's outcome, performance rose dramatically. Low-performing doctors saw the biggest improvement in performance and patient outcomes.
og.title: Expanded insurance, pay-for-performance boost health care
